entity.bdy:
This is a complete filmography of
Mickey Rourke . This list includes information about films which starred by
Mickey Rourke , notes, awards, his television works, trivias, highest-grossing films, critical acclaim of the Mickey's films, shows where Mickey Rourke appeared, roles he turned down etc. You can also find information about his other works and previous collaborations.
Mickey Rourke began his career in the film
1941 , which directed by
Steven Spielberg
. Later, Rourke starred in television movies and made brief appearances in movies. He made his breakthrough performance in the film
Diner . Later, his career continuing with popular films such as 9Â½ Weeks,
The Pope of Greenwich Village
,
Rumble Fish
,
Year of the Dragon ,
Barfly ,
Angel Heart and many more. Rourke also starred in the film about
Francis of Assisi
,
Francesco . In early 90s he returns to the boxing and doesn't starred in many films and he turned down the many key roles in his career. In the 2000s, he returned to the A-list actors list and won
Saturn Award for his performance in
Sin City . Mickey was credited as "Sir" Eddie Cook in the films which he written. Rourke worked with well-known actors including Jack Nicholson, Robert De Niro and
Christopher Walken .
Mickey starred in theater films, direct-to-video films and television works. He also written some of his film under the name "Sir" Eddie Cook. You find information below about all of them and film's directors. Only his film
Animal Factory listed on theater films because although film premiered on television firstly, film premiered on theaters. Rourke also made cameo appearances in some of his films like The Pledge or They Crawl. You also can find upcoming films of Rourke.

Trivia for films
Rumble Fish
(1984): Mickey's father died on the shoot date of this film. Film also stars
Matt Dillon . The sound technicians on the film had a hard time hearing Mickey Rourke's dialogue on set, often asking him to speak louder. As a result, the sound crew referred to the production as "Mumble Fish".
Angel Heart (1987); Alan Parker offered the role of Harry Angel to Al Pacino, Jack Nicholson and Robert De Niro himself before Mickey Rourke was cast. Film won Saturn Award and helped to fame of Mickey Rourke.
Homeboy (1988): Rourke actually worked on screenplay on his younger times, he talked about this screenplay to the actor
Christopher Walken on the set of Heaven's Gate (1980), and later the role offered to him. It was their second film together 1. Debra Feuer, which is wife of Rourke starred in the film as Rourke's character's love interest. Stephen Baldwin was given a small role in the film, he and Rourke have remained good friends ever since. It's the first film written by Rourke but his name credited as "Sir" Eddie Cook like all of his film which he written . Mickey Rourke is a good friend of French singer and painter Tristan, whom designed, among other things, the "tiger jacket" Rourke wears in Homeboy 2.
Francesco (1989): Francesco is award-winner film, where Rourke plays St. Francis of Assisi and film also stars
Helena Bonham Carter
. Rourke's political views came under fire when he claimed to have donated part of his salary from the 1989 film,
Francesco , to the
Provisional Irish Republican Army .3. Rourke spent an entire week up on a Northern Italian mountain range to prepare for the final scenes of divine inspiration in the film. Mickey also loves film of director that named The Night Porter. There are rumors about Mickey Rourke and H. Bonham Carter had some problems on set.
Johnny Handsome (1989): Offered to Al Pacino, before Rourke.
Desperate Hours (1990): Mickey Rourke recevied Razzie Award nomination for his role in this film together with Wild Orchid4. It was one of the works of Mickey together with Michael Cimino. Film also stars
Anthony Hopkins
and
Mimi Rogers .
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man (1991): Only film which made for money 5
Bullet (1995): Mickey Rourke and Tupac Shakur became friends after the shooting. Rourke was also music supervisor and chose all of the songs for this film.
John Grisham's The Rainmaker (1997): Originally a two minute longer cameo appearance, test audiences liked his role so much he was brought back for reshoots and an extended role. Rourke changed colour of his hair for this film. Film starred by ensemble cast.
Point Blank (1998): Mickey's car in the film was his personal car at the time.
Love in Paris (1998): Mickey personally asked Kim Basinger to reprise her role in the sequel but she refused as she was doing L.A. Confidential. Film usually distrubitued as direct-to-video.
Man on Fire (2004): Rourke get the role after
Christopher Walken turned down the role 6.
Domino (2005): Rourke turned down the role in Revolver (2005) for making this film. Rourke initially turned down the film, saying he did not like the role, but agreed to do the film when Tony Scott had the role rewritten.7
Sin City (2005): Michael Madsen was considered for the role of Mickey Rourke. It would be one of the works which Christopher Walken and Mickey Rourke together, but Walken turned down the role in this film.

This list includes films which considered or turned down by
Mickey Rourke . You can find information about these films and actor(s) who get the part. Mickey turned down the several key roles in his career. 89

Axel Foley was originally going to be played by Sylvester Stallone or Mickey Rourke.

Stuntman Mike

Mickey Rourke, Sylvester Stallone and Ving Rhames were other actors said to be considered for the part of "Stuntman Mike" before Kurt Russell stepped into the role.
Highlander ''
Connor 'The Highlander' MacLeod/Russell Edwin Nash
Christopher Lambert
Considered
In the Cut ''
Mickey was cast in one of the main roles but Nicole Kidman stated she wouldn't work with him, even though she hadn't meet him before. She later dropped out of the lead role herself.
Pulp Fiction''
Butch Collidge
Bruce Willis
Role offered to Rourke, Rourke passed for his boxing career.
Ingloruis Bastards''
Michael Madsen
Quentin Tarantino reportedly wrote the screenplay with Mickey Rourke in mind. Tarantino changed his mind when Robert Rodriguez used Rourke in Once Upon a Time in Mexico and Sin City.
Luck of the Draw''
Mickey Rourke was replaced after a complication about whether he could include his pet chihuahua in a scene.
The Outsiders ''
Mickey Rourke made a good impression during the casting of "The Outsiders" but wasn't quite right for any of those parts. Coppola then cast him for the follow-up "Rumble Fish."

Previous collaborations
During his career, Rourke worked with directors including
Steven Spielberg
,
Lawrence Kasdan
,
Francis Ford Coppola
,
Barry Levinson ,
Stuart Rosenberg ,
Nicolas Roeg
, Michael Cimino,
Adrian Lyne
,
Alan Parker ,
Mike Hodges
,
Barbet Schroeder , Walter Hill,
Tsui Hark
,
Terrence Malick , Jonas Ã kerlund, Wong Kar Wai,
Tony Scott
,
Robert Rodriguez
and
John Madden , as well as actors-turned-directors Sean Penn,
Vincent Gallo
and
Steve Buscemi . Rourke also starred in the films which also stars popular actors including
Kim Basinger
, Jean Claude Van Damme,
Helena Bonham Carter
,
Matt Damon
,
Danny DeVito ,
Tupac Shakur
,
Bruce Willis
,
Benicio del Toro ,
Alicia Silverstone
,
Anthony Hopkins
, Jack Nicholson,
Willem Dafoe
,
Johnny Depp
,
Denzel Washington
,
Antonio Banderas
,
Salma Hayek
, Robert De Niro and so on. Rourke worked with actor
Christopher Walken 5 times. They starred together in the films
Heaven's Gate ,
Homeboy ,
Man on Fire ,
Domino and voice acting in video game (2005).
Christopher Walken stated to the
Film Comment on August, 1992 that destiny to make Homeboy with Mickey Rourke:
â
Mickey Rourke and I were in Heaven's Gate together; he had this tiny part and I was playing whatsisname. We were sitting up there in the mountains talking about...dinosaurs. And I told him about this thing I had read in some science magazine, that there's a theory that dinosaurs really never disappeared at all. That in fact all they did was get smaller and smaller, their scales turned into feathers and they flew away-and that in fact dinosaurs are still with us, there just birds. And Mickey said, âThat's interesting,â and he started telling me about this movie that he was going to do someday about a boxer and it was called Homeboy. You know, I remember also he told me at the time, âThere's this guy, the fighters manager, and your gonna play this part.â I said, âOkay Mickey, lets go.â So almost ten years went by and there we were making it. And I said to him, âWhy donât I tell that story about the birds and dinosaurs?â He said. âRight.â And there is that scene at the beach with all the seagulls, talking about dinosaurs. It's completely disconnected from anything going on in the movie, but I think it's one of the things in the movie...It's real. Here are these two guys who are really kind of victims, talking about the origin and destiny of dinosaurs.10
â
Other works
Mickey Rourke made stage debut in revival of
Arthur Miller
's "A View From the Bridge". Mickey Rourke also made voice acting in the video games
Driv3r
(2004) as Jericho and (2005) as , which was the his fifth and last work with actor
Christopher Walken . He also appeared Japanese TV commercial for Suntory Reserve (early 90s) and commercial for
Toyota .
Rourke starred in a music video,
Hero . He played a gangster in this
Enrique Iglesias music video. Actress
Jennifer Love Hewitt
also made an appearance in this clip. Rourke also provided the mid-song rap on the
David Bowie
song "Shining Star (Makin' My Love)" on his album Never Let Me Down (1987).
